p: Firstly, we examine the variability in epidemic dynamics, as a function of arrival dates of an infectious human in a susceptible population. To do this, we ran simulations for introductions on all 365 calendar days of the year, with all other parameters fixed at their default values ( Table 2) and default starting conditions ( S1 File). Each simulation was started on February 15 (the phase shift in the annual cycle) and ran for 2 years.
